revised_title: A Detailed Study of the Skull Structure and Development in the Common Fowl (Gallus domesticus)
tldr: This study investigates the structure and development of the skull in the common fowl (Gallus domesticus) from the fourth day of incubation to extreme old age. The research focuses on the differentiation of cartilage and bone, as well as the morphological regions and their comparison in various bird types. The findings provide valuable insights into the skull development in birds and its relation to other vertebrates.
